metadata.title: CVE-2018-1054 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An out-of-bounds memory read flaw was found in the way 389-ds-base handledcertain LDAP search filters, affecting all versions including 1.4.x. Aremote, unauthenticated attacker could potentially use this flaw to makens-slapd crash via a specially crafted LDAP request, thus resulting indenial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1054` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

389-ds - 1.4.1.5-1
389-ds-base - 1.4.1.5-1
389-ds-base-libs - 1.4.1.5-1
cockpit-389-ds - 1.4.1.5-1
python3-lib389 - 1.4.1.5-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: 389-ds-base package in esm-apps/focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.1.5-1').
